The NAEB Research committee has been very active. Members have
screened several applications each year for modest research grants-in-aid,
have published several research manuals and conducted the 1957 Research
Seminar. The Membership committee (together with the Board of Directors)
considers and passes on applications for Active and Associate membership,
and, by having its members selected on a regional basis, works to bring
new members into the Association. The Publications committee assists in
obtaining articles for the NAEB Journal and acts in a general advisory capa¬
city for editorial matters for both the Journal and the Newsletter.
It would be impossible to do justice to NAEB committee activity in
this brief report. However, we want to emphasize again that the committee
structure of the NAEB, and the voluntary contributions and loyalties on which
it is based, constitute the unique sources of strength of the Association,
and assure its continuation.
